fields.description:
I want to be able to add instructions that are only visible in editing mode.
This is to be able to provide users with detailed instructions needed to create a page from a template or fill in sections of existing pages.
fields.summary: Comments only visible in editing mode

fields.description:
Templates throw an error when values are substitued which contain invalid regular expression sequences.

This is because the replacement string passed to String.replaceAll is parsed for certain significant strings such as regular expression group references ($n) and escaped literals (\x) and we do not escape these sequences.

Symptoms:

StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - when replacement text ends in a backslash
IllegalArgumentException: Illegal group reference - when replacement text contains a dollar sign followed by a number
fields.summary: Templates throw error when variables contain certain strings

fields.description: When browsing AD groups in Confluence and clicking through one of the groups to see its members, the subsequent page does not show any users.
fields.summary: Can't find group members of group when DN does not include username

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Enable captcha.
2. Find a comment on a page/blog post.
3. Click 'Reply to comment'.
4. Bug! No captcha displayed.
5. Enter something, hit Post. 
6. Bug! Error message appears: captcha not filled in correctly. There was no captcha shown to the user. Captcha _is_ shown at this point, and can be entered successfully.
fields.summary: Captcha is not shown on reply-to comment form

fields.description: See attached screenshot. I think there should be a clearer separation between the comments section and the page body section. It looks especially disconcerting when there is more vertical white space within the page body itself than between the page body and the comments section.
fields.summary: 'Add comment' link is startlingly close to page body text at times - may confuse some users

fields.description:
It seems that Confluence 2.2 automatically/silently disables plugins when they are uninstalled, and subsequently reinstalling the plugin (or upgrading it) doesn't re-enable it.

I came across this while upgrading a plugin via the Plugin Repository client, which (1) uninstalled the old version and (2) installed the new one, but didn't re-enable it.  As a result the corresponding macros were unusable until I had a look at the regular admin/Plugins page and saw all the red stuff.  Simply clicking on Enable plugin solved the problem.

The adaptavist guys say they will fix the repository client so that it re-enables plugins after upgrading, but is this a feature or a bug from Confluence 2.2?
fields.summary: Uninstalling a plugin also disables it; reinstalling doesn't re-enable it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6078].
  {panel}

Have attached a SWF file to a Confluence page. Have not been able to get it to display. Failed attempts to display the file within the page have included the following markups:

 !WhereisStuff.swf\|height=800,width=600\!n results in the Saved page displaying: 
View the Introductory Confluence Flash clip - !WhereisStuff.swf|height=800,width=600!

{flash:WhereIsStuff} resulted in message that there were no files of that name attached.
fields.summary: Unable to recognize SWF attachment

fields.summary: Dead link in Administration > User Macros - [Configuring user macros] page not found

fields.description: I have about 200 groups from LDAP and 35 local groups.  When I first go to Manage Groups screen, I see a list of 10 groups appearing in some random order (NOT alphabetical) and an continuation of pages 1-10 and next button.  First issue - please show MORE than 10 on a page.  I would like 25 or more!  Anyway, if I click on the 10th one then click NEXT, I get an new list of possible pages from 1-20 and next button.  Now things seem to be orderer alphabetically including  items on the page that use to be in the earlier pages!  I can't go back and click on pages 1-10 cause then it goes back to previous behavior (only showing 1-10 and NOT in alphabetically order).  Click on page 20 and magically 4 more pages are possible - from 1-24 and next button.  Looks alphabetical.  Then I click on page 21 and now its starting to show me my Confluence defined groups in alphabetical order EXCEPT for confluence-user and confluence-administrators which show on the LAST page at the end.  There is no subsetting or searching on this screen, so it is very unmanagable.
fields.summary: Manage Groups behaving badly with LDAP

Attachment upgrade tasks need to cater for old attachment handling bugs

fields.description:
Confluence allows attachments file names to be changed to a file name that is already attached to the page.

In 2.1.x, this led to the original attachment data being clobbered on disk, but left two attachments in the database.

In 2.2 data on disk is preserved, but as we request attachments by file name the actual attachment returned is non-deterministic.

This probably also has ramifications for attachment upgrade tasks processing pre 2.2 instances
fields.summary: Attachments can be renamed to an already existing attachment name

fields.description:
Our LDAP server associates users into groups via their displayname via the memberOf attribute , e.g:

CN=Jennings\, Donald,CN=Users,DC=rkv,DC=ad,DC=celera,DC=com

But we need to use sAMAccount names to allow users to login: e.g.

jennindg

The only way that confluence seems to be able to associate a user with a group is if the login name/attribute  is the same as the memberOf attribute. Is there a way to tell confluence that that users are authenicated by one attribute and associated with groups using another attribute? I attach our atlassianUserContext.xml LDAP xml fragment below:

    <!-- LDAP Configuration -->
    <bean id="ldapRepository" class="com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.repository.DefaultLDAPRepository" singleton="true" >
        <constructor-arg>
            <props>
                <prop key="com.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.maxsize">0</prop>
                <prop key="com.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.initsize">10</prop>
                <prop key="com.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.prefsize">10</prop>
                <!-- ldap connection pool debugging setting -->
<!--                <prop key="com.sun.jndi.ldap.connect.pool.debug">fine</prop> -->

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6062].
  {panel}

On try to export page from history as PDF Confluence gives current version.
How I reproduced:
1) created new page
2) edited content
3) opened Info->View page history and clicked on first version of document
4) Clickin on 'export page to pdf' gives current version (but not selected)

Workaround
Restore the historical version that you would like to export, export it and restore the current version.
You can delete these restores if you do not want it cluttering your history.

fields.description:
In group picker, users are not told why they cannot see groups they are not a member of, and have logged support issues saying that the groups are broken when they add a custom group without adding themselves to it (see CONF-6044). There is no reminder that they must be a member of a group to restrict access to it. 

Adding a sentence reminder to the group picker requires adding a variable since the gorup picker code is resused in space adminstration section as well as when editing page restrictions.
fields.summary: Group picker for page restrictions silently hides non-member groups, may need clarifying sentence added

fields.description:
Under Page Edit -> Restictions, when restricting page operations to groups, group entry text box does not validate that a user is a member before applying the group restriction. This can lock users out of their own pages. Instead, it should display an error same as 'Group not found' such as 'User must be a member of this group'.

To replicate, used 2.2 std and created new space. Added new group of which user is not a member, edited homepage of new test space and under restrictions went to group picker. Test group was correctly not displayed, only default groups. However the group name the user does not belong to can be entered manually without using picker menu, and is accepted.


David
fields.summary: Users can manually restrict pages operations to custom groups of which  they are not members

fields.description:
Currently to get to your personal space, it is a two step process - 'view profile' and then 'personal space'.

Seeing as people (me) want to do this frequently, it would be better to be one click.

The perfect place to link this is the users name on the top right hand side of the page.
fields.summary: Link personal spaces from a user's name on the top right hand side
Specify in System properties whether Confluence is running as a standalone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6054].
  {panel}

When editing a page, the top half of the page springs up fairly quickly...then pauses, then the edit window shows up a several seconds later.

The HTML can be upwards of 150Kb, even with only 30 characters of actual content.

The reason seems to be the newSpaceKey drop-down which on a large site can have hundreds, or in our enterprise installation, *thousands* of spacekeys and descriptions - totally some 90kb.

I find that users less frequently move pages *between* spaces, so this seems like a great place for a bit of Ajax magic to speed things up. Also, a drop-down of 1,750 spaces is almost impossible to use, so I'd like the option of just displaying the *favorite spaces* and/or the ability to type a spacekey to search for the spaces.

If you have a large or rapidly growing Confluence site, and plan to have many public spaces, you might want to vote for this issue. :-)


Timo

fields.summary: System error clicking next on manage users

fields.description:
Trying to open the PDF file results in this error: 

"There was an error processing a page. There was a problem reading this document (109)"

Trying to restore the XML file (Administration Guide - DOC-20070323-XML.zip) results in this error:

"Import failed. net.sf.hibernate.HibernateException: Error processing backup. Refer to logs for more details"
fields.summary: Export of Documentation Space to PDF and XML restoration are broken

fields.description:
The text below:

public static _*Interface*_ TypeResponse Create_*Interface*_ (ImportType importType, _*Interface*_ Type\[\] list)

Produces a wrong text when the page is being viewed. The first "Interface" is displayed bold and italic. The second is displayed bold, and italic markers are displayed. The thirdy is displayed bold and italic.

If I use the WYSISWYG editor and select the words, and select Bold and Italic in the menu (for each word), the text is well-displayed in edit mode. But when saving the page, the text is displayed wrong again.

The text is not encapsulated in any {code} snippet, and is not encapsuled in {{ }} braces (for monospaced font).
fields.summary: Repeating italic and bold markers (_, *) in the same line makes the view gets confused (display some text as bold, some as italic, and some marks)
Switching between rich text editor and wiki editor breaks markup

fields.description:
After a reinstall of the Oracle database and installation of a higher version of Tomcat a full export of the former 2.1.5 database was applied (without any problems). When trying to add a new user an exception is thrown stating that a ORA-0001: constraint violation has occured. The involved constraint is the primary key of the OS_USER table which can not be disabled and has dependencies to other database objects. 
All allready registered users are able to work as usual.
fields.summary: Can not create new users after importing Confluence 2.1.5 full-export into 2.2

fields.description:
In Confluence 2.2 created groups are not shown in the listing of a space permission page. They can only be assigned to a space when the group name is added manually to the selection box.
Only the two default groups confluence_administrators and confluence_users are shown.
fields.summary: Created groups are not shown in Space permission site
Improve the SQL macro

fields.description: We have a number of group names that have a "&" in them.  Everything after the & is cut off.
fields.summary: LDAP group names that contain "&" cause problems

fields.description:
Insert the following text to a page in the Wiki editor:
{noformat}
# h2. numbered heading
test
## second-level list item
## another item
{noformat}
The preview will show (minus formatting) something like:

  1. numbered heading
      test
        1. second-level list item
        2. another item

Switch to the WYSIWYG editor, and then switch back to the preview, without making any changes. The result will be:

  1. numbered heading
test
  1.  1. second-level list item
       2. another item

Note the badly indented text following the heading, and the excess numbering inserted to the second-level list.
fields.summary: headings declared in list items break the list

fields.description:
If the members of a group are stored in the form: 

     member: CN=John Smith,CN=example,CN=com

Where the _full name_ is used to unqiuely identify a member (that is "CN=John Smith" instead of "CN=jsmith"), then Confluence will not be able to display the members of an LDAP group. 

Please note: This bug IS NOT related to membership queries. That is, even though Confluence does not display any members of 'LDAP Group', if you grant 'LDAP Group' USE permissions, the LDAP users in this group  should _still_ be able to log in.
fields.summary: Members of LDAP groups are not being displayed

fields.description:
Windows AD supports using DNS and the SRV record type to provide information about a service.

The record _ldap._tcp.ad.company.com will return a list of SRV records listing the port and DNS name of all the valid LDAP servers for the domain. This allows clients to find an LDAP server in the event that the primary server becomes unavailable or decomissioned.
fields.summary: Active Directory: support for DNS SRV records to locate an AD/LDAP server (_ldap._tcp.)

fields.description: I guess in common with many LDAP users, we use a lot of dynamic grouping and roles for handling groups of LDAP users, and Atlassian user currently doesn't support this. We could create an LDAP group, grant it authorisation in Confluence, then add all our LDAP users to that group. However, the people who manage Confluence do not entirely map onto the people who manage our LDAP servers. It would be useful if one could choose for LDAP users to be automatically added to a pre-determined database group (such as confluence-users).
fields.summary: Automatically add LDAP users to confluence-users (or other databse-stored group)

fields.summary: Error starting up Confluence 2.2

fields.description:
After upgrading from version 2.0.2 to 2.14, we started receiving various oracle contratint errors. These occured mostly when editing existing content and saving but sometimes would happen when new content was created. I upgraded to 2.1.5a and to 2.2 this past weekend.

After upgrading to 2.2 I tried creating a new user and got the constraint error every time. Just for a lark, I disabled the constraint in question (see below for the details) and created a new user. The user was created ok but I observed that the new row in the OS_USER table was using an id of a user that was already in the system. I tried to figure out where the new user ids were being generated from but gave up. It looks like whatever table/mechanism the user creation and by extention other parts of the system to create the new keys is somehow corrupted/reset. If someone could give me a hand on debugging this I would be greatful. We're rolling Confluence out to the rest of the company this week and I would like to get this resolved as quick as I can such that the new folks can starting creating content without these errors.

Your product is awesome and it gets used every day by a bunch of folks.

Here is the exception I get when trying to create a user:
Cause:

fields.description:
I know this sort of defeats the purpose of a wiki, but it would enable us to still use it for producing "official" documents. 

Many corporate project sites that have document management (eRoom to name one) also have a downloadable plugin (standalone program) for handling documents that runs on the users computer. What this plugin essentially does is:
* When the user clicks a link to a document it downloads it and opens it (Word/Excel etc)
* The document is locked for concurrent editing
* When the document is closed the plugin checks if it has been edited, if so it will display a box asking if you wish to upload the change and write a comment.

We use Confluence for a lot of things in our company, but for producing official documentation that we send to our clients it doesn't cut it. I am a big fan of not storing stuff in Word documents but on the Wiki for easy editing and reading. BUT it's too big of a hassle making it work in Word later on if it's all written on the Wiki. Therefore such a feature would enable us to have all the informal info and notes on the Wiki but still working on the offical doc as attachments.
fields.summary: Edit attachment plugin

fields.description:
Maybe there is a way to do this and I just haven't found it?

Confluence has subscript and superscript formatting options, but they seem to require spaces before them or they are ignored, which renders them useless in all the cases where I would want to use them.  For instance:

The formula for water is H~2~O and it is 1g/cm^3^.

This appears exactly like that on the page.  If I want the formatting to work I can do this:

The formula for water is H ~2~ O and it is 1g/cm ^3^ .

But that's ugly on the page with all that extra space.

If just making the first example work is not easy, something like this might be good:

The formula for water is H{~2~}O and it is 1g/cm{^3^}.

Have some kind of brackets or something that says to the editor "this is markup" without requiring a space.  Is there somethng like this already?  I can't find anything in the documentation.

Thanks!
fields.summary: no space required before sub/superscript

fields.description:
{noformat}

I sometimes use {html} mode to do formatting beyond what I can get with Confluence's markup language.  An example might be:

The formula for water is H{html}<sub>2</sub>{html} and it is 1g/cm{html}<sup>3</sup>{html}

When I later view this page in Rich Text mode, it becomes:

The formula for water is H
{html}<SUB>2</SUB>{html} and it is 1g/cm
{html}<SUP>3</SUP>{html}

Which appears as:

The formula for water is H
2 and it is 1g/cm
3

This happens even if I wasn't editing this section -- anyone who edits such a page in Rich Text mode will destroy the formatting.  I've seen more complicated and disasterous results as well.  In general the Rich Text editor just doesn't seem to understand the {html} tag and has a tendency to trash anything done with it.

I consider being able to use HTML when all else fails to be pretty crucial.  So hopefully this can be fixed.  Thanks!

{noformat}
fields.summary: Rich Text edit mode adds unwanted line returns before {html} tags

fields.description:

1) Extract Confluence Standalone.
2) Copy Oracle JDBC driver 10.2.0.1 to common/lib directory. 
3) Set up confluence.home in file conluence-init.properties appropriatelly.
4) Start confluence via ./startup.sh; JAVA_HOME points to JDK 1.5.0_04-b05.

fields.description:
A customer has requested that Confluence URLs become more flexible in order to support imported URL structures. Moving to new URLs that all include 'display' means all old content will need to restablish itself in search engines.

The specific comment from the customer:

> I would like to migrate from my current (Drupal based) website. I've 
> taken some effort to ensure that all my URLs are sensible to help Google 
> ratings and to help migration. It seems that under Confluence all URLs 
> have some structure enforced on them - "display" is part of it. I would 
> like to keep my URLs the same as I migrate (that way I could migrate 
> over section by section) and it means that the search engines don't have 
> to learn a new site structure.
fields.summary: URL formats need more flexibility to reflect imported site structures in order to preserve search engine ranks

fields.description:
Currently, fully qualified references to attachments make use of the underlying physical storage/organization scheme , ie:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Release+Notes+2.1.5 has one attachment which is accesed via
http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/166236/PagePickerAction.properties

I would like to see a more abstracted url scheme for attachments that would look more like
http://confluence.example.com/display/DOC/Release+Notes+2.1.5/attachments/PagePickerAction.properties
or even 
http://confluence.example.com/display/DOC/Release+Notes+2.1.5/PagePickerAction.properties

Why? I am trying to automate some junit test result publication into a Confluence space. The junitreport macro wants a directory (ick) or a fully qualified url - not a wiki link. While fixing the junitreport macro would fix the immediate problem, adding a logical reference scheme for attachments would probably solve a broader class of problems.
fields.summary: Attachment logical url scheme

fields.description:
The Confluence User Guide is invaluable for new users, but it can only be viewed online and it is impossible to print. A more accessible version of the guide might be well received. There are two obvious ways to go about this -

1) A printable PDF. Html-to-pdf converters currently generate poor quality results, but a depth-first dump of pages in the documentation space may be a good first step.
2) A dump of the local page tree from a web crawler that can be made available for download, or even be bundled with the Confluence installation.

If there is sufficient user demand, it could be worthwhile to make the guide available in one or both of these formats.
fields.summary: Create Confluence User Guide 2.0 in offline html or pdf format for printability

fields.description:
1) When I export pages to PDF, HTML links in tables overflow table boundaries and tend to be truncated.
2) When I deselect all pages, and then select a page at the top of the hierarchy I want to print to PDF, I have to manually select every page under the top of my highest level page. I anticipate having about 100 pages for some PDF "books". Selection should automatically select everything below a selected page so that I don't have this wearisome error-prone task.
3) It should be possible to move a set pages under a specific page to the last position among the list of pages. It seems that Confluence tries to produce those pages in the order in which they were created.

fields.description:
# Create a new test page with the body saying {dynamictasklist}
# Add a new item to the task list, say "test 1"
# Add another item and name it "test %".  You will now get a NPE.  Refresh your browser after you get the NPE.

You will have the tasklist with the first item in the list showing up correctly and the second line just saying (del) with the red "x" to delete the line.  If you click "del" on the blank line (the one that was supposed to have the %) or try to reorder the line you wil get the NPE.  See below for the stack trace.

Once this happens I don't see anyway to salvage the page except to delete the whole page.  If I remove the {dynamictasklist}, save the page and then add it back it comes back with the blank line from the %.  The only way I have found to get around the issue is to delete the page and then recreate it.

fields.description:
Revisions to consecutive table rows are not shown properly in the page history -- only the first row in the series is shown properly.

Start with the following test case:

| A | A |
| B | B |
| C | C |
| D | D |

Make these edits:

| A | a |
| B | b |
| C | c |
| D | d |

Version history shows these changes (I'll use unified diff format here):

-| A | A |
-| B | |
-| C | |
-| D | |
+| A | a |
+| B | |
+| C | |
+| D | |
fields.summary: Revisions on consecutive table rows are not shown

fields.description:
I would like to have an option "exclude" for the children macro (and perhaps contentsbylabel as well).

Current situation:

I have some administrative pages in each space, e. g. some includes for the spaces main-page which should not "disturb" the normal users. Current solution is to have a page "Content" and a page "Admin" below the space's homepage and only show the children of "Content". But this has one problem: Most of the time users visit the spaces homepage and press "Add Page" and this will never be shown as "Content". It's hard to administrate such "lost" pages. Therefore I would prefer only to have the "Admin" page as special page but exclude it in the space's homepage like:

{children:excerpt=true|exclude=Admin}

I think a comma-separated list would be most convenient as possible arguments to exclude:

{children:excerpt=true|exclude=Admin,Ignore Me}

Additional Idea:

Perhaps an excplicit "include" might be also desirable (or just extend the page-option to also allow comma-separated lists)... but this should be stated in comments if someone is interested in it. Currently we won't need it :-)
fields.summary: Add exclude option to children macro
